thread.title: Watch: Where did van Zyl's putter go? | Golf Channel
thread.title_full: Watch: Where did van Zyl's putter go? | Golf Channel

title: Watch: Where did van Zyl's putter go? | Golf Channel
text:
RSS 
Jaco van Zyl turned plenty of heads Thursday at the Joburg Open. 
The South African used a very unusual putter that was barely noticeable when he lined up on the green. Van Zyl decided to use a Cleveland Smart Square Stubby putter that is normally used as a training aid. 
The putter is a smaller version of the Smart Square Blade putters and is designed to train golfers to consistently hit the sweetspot. 
Van Zyl was 1 under par after 13 holes before play was suspended. 
Contributions from writers and editors on the Golf Channel Digital team. Editor's Picks
